meanings.definition: To give more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outgive her friends during the holidays.
meanings.sent2: He decided to outgive his coworkers by donating extra money to charity.
meanings.sent3: The competition to outgive each other at the fundraiser was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outgive even in tough times is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The millionaire's goal was to outgive everyone in the community.

meanings.definition: To be more generous in giving than others.
meanings.sent1: They constantly outgive their neighbors by helping with chores.
meanings.sent2: The organization aims to outgive other charities in providing aid.
meanings.sent3: It's a friendly rivalry to see who can outgive the most at the food drive.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was always ready to outgive, no matter the circumstances.
meanings.sent5: The philanthropist's mission is to outgive all others and make a difference.
